ratings.question_text: Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: I had weekly one-on-one meeting with my Thesis advisor and my mentor. Outside of these meetings I worked diligently on my thesis paper.
This course was an independent study course, but I met with my advisor on  Zoom multiple times.

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I learned about the process of writing up scientific findings (intro, methods, discussion, etc), important statistical skills, publication research skills, how to critically read scientific research, how to frame and discuss a study, and what goes into the research we see published everyday on Pubmed, for example. Furthermore, I learned about negative life events and how to measure them in a lab setting, different stress tests like the TSST discussed in my thesis paper, adolescence and the psychosocial changes that occur during this time period, and the stress response system and how negative life events affect the physiological measures of this system. The knowledge I have acquired in this course is invaluable, and I am incredibly grateful for the support and mentorship of my advisor and mentor throughout the writing and research process.
I developed critical thinking skills, learned more about R statistics, and wrote my senior essay on my empirical research.
I learned how to conduct a literature review for my empirical paper. I also learned how to run statistical analyses through R and learned more about how to utilize Qualtrics to create my study.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: My advisor held weekly one-on-one meetings, which was helpful for checking in on my progress. We also established a timeline for the semester at our first meeting, which was helpful for keeping track of my progress.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)

Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
